docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON - It was a scene straight out of the feel-good 90s: The Goo Goo Dolls were the headliners, Terry McAuliffe was the emcee and royal blue placards advocating a Clinton for president filled the auditorium.
docs.abstract: The Democratic candidate makes a stop in Boston.
docs.snippet: The Democratic candidate makes a stop in Boston.

docs.lead_paragraph: PICKETS, THEN A PROPOSAL Six hours after union leaders sent Chrysler's 45,000 workers to the picket lines, the United Automobile Workers and the automaker announced a tentative agreement. The terms are expected to echo the contract that was hammered out by the union and General Motors after a two-day walkout last month.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first review of Conscience of a Liberal I've seen, by Tyler Cowen:
docs.abstract: The first review of Conscience of a Liberal I've seen, by Tyler Cowen: Krugman calls for single-payer health insurance, tax hikes, and raising the minimum wage. He doesn't come off as all that radical. And of course I'm not. It's people who want to privatize Social Security and eliminate inheritance taxes who are the real [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: All that and a bag of S-chip: Conservative bloggers are in an introspective mood after the blogburst of outrage, much of it now retracted, over the economic status of the family of 12-year-old Graeme Frost, who gave the Democratic response to President Bush's radio address on Sept. 29. (See this story in The Times for details.)
docs.abstract: The political shouting match over the 12-year-old boy who became a symbol of the fight over the S-chip legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: My colleague David Leonhardt suggests that people don't feel that bad about the economy:

headline.main: How do people feel about the economy?

docs.abstract: My colleague David Leonhardt suggests that people don't feel that bad about the economy: In the most recent CBS News poll, 50 percent of respondents said the economy was very good or fairly good, while 47 percent said it was very bad or fairly bad. Fair enough. But results in such polls are very dependent [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: A New Jersey hospital suspended 27 employees after they pried into the medical records of George Clooney and his companion, who were hurt in a motorcycle accident.

headline.main: Hospital Workers Punished for Peeking at Clooney File
headline.print_headline: Hospital Workers Suspended For Peeking at Clooney’s Files
